forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 55. Southwest wind 12 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph.

weather_report:
As the city sleeps under a mostly cloudy shroud, the air feels mild and whispery, suggesting a low around 55 degrees. The gentle southwest breeze, playful yet persistent, flits through the night, teasing the remnants of fog that cling to the buildings like old memories—if only to remind us of summer's impending warmth. As dawn approaches, the fog may be ready to yield, with the promise of a sunlit day ahead.

Come Thursday, the skies are set to transition to predominantly sunlit realms, hints of blue peeking through the high clouds. Our high will nestle comfortably near 64 degrees, dipping to around 62 as the afternoon unveils itself. With the winds picking up—a spirited chorus from the west-southwest—breezes will dance between 7 and 24 mph, whisking away any lingering coolness. Today offers a serene yet brisk atmosphere, one that invites a sweater layered over a light shirt, perhaps paired with jeans or comfortable slacks for an excursion outdoors. Glistening morning light makes this an exceptional day to wander along the Embarcadero, engaging with the artistry of the city’s architecture or savoring a quiet stroll among the parks. Whether it's a simple coffee in a cozy café or an exploration of the myriad shops that line the streets, today beckons in an understated yet compelling way.
